quizzes.question: What are style sheets used for?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Welcome to CSS! [/h1]

CSS stands for [b]C[/b]ascading [b]S[/b]tyle [b]S[/b]heets.  

- [b]Cascading [/b]refers to the way CSS applies one style on top of another.
- [b]Style Sheets[/b] control the look and feel of web documents.

[b]CSS [/b]and [b]HTML [/b]work hand in hand:
- HTML sorts out the page structure.
- CSS defines how HTML elements are displayed.
[note]To understand CSS, you should already have a basic knowledge of HTML.
If you want to study HTML, check out the free SoloLearn [b]Learn HTML[/b] app.[/note]

quizzes.question: Why use CSS?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Why Use CSS? [/h1]

CSS allows you to apply specific styles to specific HTML elements.

The main benefit of CSS is that it allows you to separate [b]style [/b]from [b]content[/b].  

Using just HTML, all the styles and formatting are in the same place, which becomes rather difficult to maintain as the page grows.
[note]All formatting can (and [b]should[/b]) be removed from the HTML document and stored in a separate CSS file.[/note]
